_metadata.description: Manual adjustments for countries with outdated UN Tourism data
_metadata.purpose: Override old/missing UN data with recent statistics from various sources

Russia.reason: UN data from 2005 is severely outdated. Russia had ~20M pre-pandemic but tourism dropped significantly after 2022 Ukraine invasion and international sanctions
Russia.notes: Down from ~24M in 2019 pre-pandemic. 2024 shows recovery to 9.7M mostly from China, CIS countries

Australia.reason: UN data from 2006 is outdated. Australia recovered to 7.6M in 2024, still below 2019 peak of 8.7M
Australia.notes: Recovery from COVID, 2024 at 89% of 2019 levels

Syria.reason: Civil war devastated tourism. Pre-war Syria had 8.5M tourists in 2010, dropped 98% by 2015. Partial recovery to ~1.5-2M by 2023, mostly Lebanese/Arab visitors. December 2024 regime change creates further uncertainty
Syria.notes: Numbers may include returning Syrian diaspora using foreign passports. Political instability continues

Zimbabwe.reason: UN data from 2001 is outdated. Zimbabwe recovering, reached 1.6M in 2023 (up from 1M in 2022), below 2018 peak of 2.6M
Zimbabwe.notes: Tourism receipts reached $1.1B in 2023. H1 2024 showed 27% growth

Pakistan.reason: UN data from 2012. Pakistan reached record ~1M tourists in 2023, 115% surge vs 2022. Previously stagnated at ~300K/year
Pakistan.notes: Launched 'Salam Pakistan' tourism brand in 2023. Recovery to 92% of pre-pandemic levels

Cameroon.reason: UN data from 2012. Cameroon had 1.02M visitors in 2019. Estimated ~1.1M in 2023 based on projections
Cameroon.notes: 2023 figure is an estimate. Peak was 1.08M in 2017
